com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.proxy

Class RevealRootPopupContentEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.web.bindery.event.shared.Event<H>
      • com.google.gwt.event.shared.GwtEvent<RevealRootPopupContentHandler>
        • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.proxy.RevealRootPopupContentEvent

  • public final class RevealRootPopupContentEvent
extends GwtEvent<RevealRootPopupContentHandler>
    This event is fired when a PresenterWidget wants to reveal itself as a popup at the root of the application. It is typically fired by the PresenterWidget's parent.
    Use this type of event to reveal popup content that should get added at the root of the presenter hierarchy.
    Author:
    Philippe Beaudoin
    See Also:
    RevealContentEvent, RevealRootContentEvent, RevealRootLayoutContentEvent

    • Method Detail

      • fire

        public static void fire(HasHandlers source,
        PresenterWidget<? extends PopupView> content)
        Fires a RevealRootPopupContentEvent into a source that has access to an EventBus.
        Parameters:
        source - The source that fires this event (HasHandlers).
        content - The PresenterWidget with a PopupView that wants to set itself as root content.

      • fire

        public static void fire(HasHandlers source,
        PresenterWidget<? extends PopupView> content,
        boolean center)
        Fires a RevealRootPopupContentEvent into a source that has access to an EventBus.
        Parameters:
        source - The source that fires this event (HasHandlers).
        content - The PresenterWidget with a PopupView that wants to set itself as root content.
        center - Pass true to center the popup, otherwise its position will not be adjusted.
